titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Benjamin Houser, James Taylor, William Harrison, Jr., Terry Brown, William Clark, Lycurges Hudson, and Jessee Hill, Indictment
CWG5468

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
Against } Anderson ^County^ Circt Court
Benjamin Houser James Taylor William Harrison jr Terry Brown William Clark Lycurges Hudson, and Jessee Hill

The Grand Jury of Anderson in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Benjamin Houser James Taylor William Harrison jr Terry Brown William Clark Lycurges Hudson and Jessee Hill of the crime of Murder and committed as follows The said Benjamin Houser James Taylor Wm Harrison Jr Terry Brown William Clark Lycurges Hudson and Jessee Hill on the 5th day of July 1864 in the county aforesaid did feloniously and of malice aforethought kill and murder John Ash by shooting him with a gun or pistol against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Witness before the Jury
James Green
Benj Ash
Mary.E. Spoonerman
S H Noble Atty for Comth
